speaker: Bulldog
text: Baby, baby.  All I'm saying is we should cool it for a while. What's that saying... er... if you love something, let it go; if it comes back to you... yadda, yadda, yadda?  Yeah, that's it.  Don't get me wrong, I'm really broken up about this. _At this point Frasier walks past and Bulldog shouts at him as he throws him a tennis ball.  Needless to say Frasier tries to catch it, juggles it like a hot potato then eventually throws his hands up in despair and goes into his booth._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_still on the phone_] Come on now.  No tears.  I'll never forget you either, Sandy.  Linda?  Really?  I thought I was talking to your sister.  Oh well, tell her same goes. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Roz
text: Hey Frasier, do you have a minute?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course, Roz.  What is it?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're not going to like this idea.  You're going to complain and make up excuses and then say no anyway.

speaker: Frasier
text: Those are the very words I would use to woo my dear Lilith.

speaker: Roz
text: OK, here goes.  I have this friend and I think you two would really hit it off...

speaker: Frasier
text: And you were wondering if I might meet her for a drink, which might lead to dinner, and then after that who knows where?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, exactly.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suddenly gets concerned_] Ooh, oh Roz.  Do you hear that?

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: If you listen very carefully you can actually hear my skin crawling!

speaker: Roz
text: I know, blind dates stink.  But she's my friend and I'm worried about her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: When was the last time you were with a woman?  Seems like almost a year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it has not been that long.  I mean, that is a laugh! Hah!  The last time was... [_thinking_] er... well, let's see... Well, the tree was still up.  Oh, God!

speaker: Roz
text: Her name is Sharon.  She's five-seven...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Roz, I'm not interested.

speaker: Roz
text: But she's an incredible person.  She's smart, she's funny, she's a former pro-golfer.  She just hasn't met the right guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: A woman golfer.  Are we quite certain there is a right guy?

speaker: Roz
text: She dates men.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_picks up his briefcase_] Not this one.

speaker: Roz
text: She plays chess.  She loves your show. [_he leaves through the door_] And I know this sort of thing isn't supposed to matter to people like you but I've seen her in the showers at the gym and she has a body that makes Bo Derek look like Bo Diddley!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_poking his head back round the door_] A chess player, did you say? **NOTHING SAYS "I LOVE" YOU LIKE DEEP FLANNEL LININGS** _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Martin walks in after taking Eddie for his walk.  However, there is no sign of Eddie.  The ankles of Martin's pants are soaked.  Daphne comes through from the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: Look at these pants.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear, Mr. Crane.  Did Eddie drag you through the puddles again?

speaker: Martin
text: Every last one of them. [_looks outside in the hall_] Eddie, get in here.  Eddie, I mean now! [_A very sheepish Eddie walks in slowly, keeping his head down_] What am I going to do with you? My favourite shoes are soaked.  Eddie, look at me when I'm talking to you.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're doing it again.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're acting like one of those nut jobs in the park who treat their pets like children.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah?  Well, when you do it outside you're a nut.  When you do it inside it's your own damn business.  Eddie, go to your room! [_Eddie runs off_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry about your shoes.  I'll get them all dried out for you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I hope.  They're not just any shoes, you know.  These are Mocarbies - the most comfortable shoes made.  Air- cushioned in-soles, deep flannel lining.  You know, I remember one anniversary I surprised Hester with a pair of Lady Mocarbies.  I don't remember which anniversary, but I know it ended with a zero.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't doubt that! _As Daphne takes off Martin's shoes and heads into the kitchen, Eddie runs out from the bedroom with Martin's slippers in his mouth._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, I forgive you.  I love you too. _Frasier walks out from his bedroom through to the living room, dressed in a suit._

speaker: Martin
text: You'll always be my very best boy. _Frasier just walks past with a look of disdain.  Martin notices the suit and whistles at him._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, there are some fathers who actually praise their sons and whistle at their dog?

speaker: Martin
text: New suit, huh?  Who's the lucky girl?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you must know I'm meeting a friend of Roz's today after work, but it's no big deal.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, congratulations.  What's it been?  A year?

speaker: Frasier
text: It has not been that long!

speaker: Martin
text: I remember the tree was still up.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, look at you all dressed up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's a new suit.  Yes, I'm meeting a woman.  And yes, it has been a while.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks, that reminds me.  I have to order my cards.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_examining the microwave_] Daphne, are you finished here with the microwave?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no! _She rushes to the microwave and opens the door, releasing a cloud of smoke just as Martin wanders into the kitchen._

speaker: Martin
text: My Mocarbies!

speaker: Daphne
text: I didn't mean to leave them in there so long.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, English cooking strikes again! _FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier and Niles are sitting at their usual table. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think you should be happy that one of your patients feels healthy enough to terminate his therapy.

speaker: Niles
text: I would, but it's happened so often lately I find myself in financial straits.  Deep financial straits.  Look at this belt: [_opens up his jacket before whispering_] Spanish leather!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well if Mr. Blackwell comes in I'll create a diversion, you can make a dash for it.

speaker: Niles
text: Obviously the time has come for me to expand my practice, so I'm placing an ad in the Seattle "Style" magazine.

speaker: Frasier
text: An advertisement?  Isn't that a bit commercial for a psychiatrist?

speaker: Niles
text: Said Dr. Pot to Dr. Kettle!  Besides, a highly respected obstetrician on my floor did it and now his waiting room has more swollen bellies than a Buddhist temple. [_laughs at his joke before handing Frasier the ad_] I'm on my way to call it in.  I just wanted to run it by you.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. [_reading ad_] "Dr. Niles Crane, Jung specialist. Servicing individuals, couples, groups.  Satisfaction guaranteed.  Tell me where it hurts."  Well, that's just excellent, Niles.  All you're missing now is a very tasteful cartoon of you smiling brightly and holding a shrunken head!

speaker: Niles
text: Sorry, I didn't hear you.  I was too distracted by your face going by on the side of a bus. [_gets up to leave_] I'm off.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, wild thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, hello.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, we have on the same belt.

speaker: Niles
text: [_horrified_] Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.  OK, Sharon's gonna be here any minute.

speaker: Frasier
text: You didn't say anything to her?

speaker: Roz
text: No, not a word.  She has no idea this is a set-up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good, good.  Now, listen.  If I don't like her I will simply excuse myself and leave.  But if I do like her I will find some polite and discrete way of hinting to you that you may go...

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Sharon!

speaker: Frasier
text: Beat it, Roz!

speaker: Sharon
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Look who I ran into.  My boss -- Dr. Frasier Crane.  Frasier, this is Sharon Payton

speaker: Sharon
text: Oh, pleased to meet you.  I'm a big fan of your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Sharon
text: I'm sure you're tired of hearing that.  You probably get it all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, not lately!

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, Sharon, I'm so sorry to do this to you but I just got a call from the office and it's urgent and I have to go.

speaker: Sharon
text: Oh, sure, that's all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, as long as you're here you might as well join me.

speaker: Sharon
text: That'd be nice.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye, Roz.

speaker: Sharon
text: You know, I really do love listening to your show.  I think it's because you have such a soothing voice.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smooth_] What a kind thing to say.

speaker: Sharon
text: I even called in once.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  May I ask what the problem was?

speaker: Sharon
text: Well, I'm terribly competitive, which is great for sports - I used to play pro-golf -- but sometimes it seeps into my personal life.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, well, I don't think that's too great a problem, but if I were to make a recommendation it might be to start seeing a therapist. _Both laugh at this.  Meanwhile Bulldog has came into the Caf e and walks up to their table. _

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa!  Hello, gorgeous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Not you.  Hey, aren't you gonna introduce me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I wasn't, no!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_introducing himself_] Bob Briscoe.

speaker: Sharon
text: [_shaking hands_] Sharon Payton.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, good to see you, Bulldog. [_trying to push him away_] Don't be a stranger.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, wait a minute, wait a minute.  Sharon Payton - I know you. [_grabs the nearest seat that happens to have someone sitting on it_] LPGA. You won the Denver Open in 1992.

speaker: Frasier
text: 1992?  You know, that's a fabulous year for a particular Chambertin I took a shine too...

speaker: Sharon
text: [_ignoring Frasier and speaking to Bulldog_] I know you too. You're that guy that says golf is not a sport.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, it's not.

speaker: Sharon
text: Really?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah.  No cheerleaders, no blood and the only cups involved are in the ground!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, this reminds me of a debate I had with my brother Niles about whether or not Steven Sondheim is really light opera...

speaker: Sharon
text: You know, I have a theory that people who put down golf do so because they can't play well.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Is that a challenge?

speaker: Sharon
text: It might be.

speaker: Bulldog
text: If we leave right now we can get in 9 holes.

speaker: Sharon
text: Loser buys dinner.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I got a 9 handicap.

speaker: Sharon
text: You're on. [_turns to Frasier_] Frasier, would you like to join us?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, I don't play.

speaker: Sharon
text: Well, it was really nice meeting you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise.

speaker: Sharon
text: I'll get my coat.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog!  Roz set this up that I might meet Sharon.  Until you got here things were going in a very positive direction.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, well, things seem to have changed, haven't they?  What do you eggheads call that?  Irony?

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there nothing I can do to appeal to your sense of decency?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, I have no sense of decency.  That way my other senses are enhanced! _Bulldog walks out with Sharon, leaving Frasier looking particularly frustrated._ **IT'S HAMMER TIME** _Scene Four - Daphne's Car Daphne is busy driving down the street while Martin is in the front seat still babbling about his shoes._

speaker: Martin
text: ...but the real secret to Mocarbies is that they mold themselves to the shape of your foot.  Now my problem was always hammer toes.  If you had hammertoes you had a hell of a time buying shoes.  But Mocarbies fit over my hammer toes like a glove.  Funny, you know?  When you're young you dream  about fame and fortune.  When you get to my age all you really want out of life is a comfy pair of shoes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Right now I'd settle for never hearing the words "hammer toes" again!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, don't give me any attitude.  Wasn't me that nuked the Mocarbies.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not the one who can't remember where the store is where you bought the damn shoes.

speaker: Martin
text: Just drive.  I'll tell you when to stop... STOP!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_braking, looking out the window_] Is that it?

speaker: Martin
text: It's a red light!  In this country we stop for those.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, all right.

speaker: Martin
text: Woman driver!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hammer toes! **WHO ARE YOU AND WHAT HAVE YOU DONE WITH BULLDOG?** _Scene Five - KACL Frasier is busy in the booth and looks bored.  Roz walks in._

speaker: Roz
text: [_punching Frasier on the arm_] Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?  Oh, oh.  Haven't you spoken with Sharon?

speaker: Roz
text: I tried but she wasn't home all weekend. [_punching Frasier on the arm_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, before you snap my behind with a wet towel, last time I saw Sharon she was leaving Cafe Nervosa with Bulldog.

speaker: Roz
text: [_punching Frasier violently on the arm_] Frasier!  How could you let that happen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know.  The whole thing was sort of a blur. We were talking about golf and something called a handicap, the next thing I know I'm sitting there with a cappuccino muttering to myself in a very soothing voice.

speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's all right, Roz.  It's just the whole thing catapulted me back to high school.  You know me as an adult, but back then I was rather an un-athletic, bookish sort.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sarcastic_] Get out!

speaker: Frasier
text: Jocks were the bane of my existence.  They would always call me a "weenie" and steal all the girls that I wanted.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh Frasier, you must have had some girlfriends.

speaker: Frasier
text: Friends, yeah, yeah.  Any time they wanted a sensitive shoulder to cry on, until some blond-headed pillar of testosterone would come by and it was, "Bye Frasier, we can study later."  I'd head home to Niles and we'd put on "The Brandenberg Concertos" and play air violin.

speaker: Roz
text: Jeez, what a couple of Nerdlingers!

speaker: Frasier
text: I suppose you were Miss Popular at High School?

speaker: Roz
text: I would say yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm guessing that explains why, too! _Bulldog walks in looking like the cat that got the cream. However, his second skin of cockiness seems to be missing._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey guys.  What a weekend...

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, Bulldog.  Sharon is my friend and you'd better not hurt her!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hurt?  Hurt her? [_swaying_] I'm crazy about her!  I never felt this way before.  You know, on my way to work, all these songs on the radio suddenly made sense to me?  Have you ever listened to the words to "Time in a Bottle"? It's so beautiful, man; I had to pull over.

speaker: Roz
text: [_horrified_] Oh my God.  It's in love!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_holding Frasier and Roz's hands_] Last night for the first time in my life I actually said those three little words -- "stay for breakfast."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_appalled_] You had sex with Sharon?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Doc, please!  We "made love."  You know what?  I gotta call her. [_picks up the phone_] No, wait.  No, I gotta play hard to get. [_slams phone down_] But I miss the sound of her voice. I'm calling her. [_picks up phone_] No, wait.  It's too needy. Chicks hate that. [_puts phone down_] I shouldn't call her. But I want to! [_picks up phone before putting it down again_] Doc, what should I do?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_by now thoroughly mystified_] Don't ask me.  I don't even know who you are! _End of Act Two  Act Two  Scene One -- The streets of Seattle. Martin and Daphne are still busy hunting for the shoe store.  Martin is looking into an old shop that is now covered with an iron grille and has obviously been closed for a while.  A homeless man is lying nearby. _

speaker: Martin
text: This was it.  This was the Mocarbies store.  Now it's gone, and so are the only shoes I've ever loved.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, look at me.  We're talking here about something that's old and smelly and dirty.

speaker: Tramp
text: Hey!

speaker: Martin
text: Not you.  We're talking about Mocarbies.

speaker: Tramp
text: Ah!  Great shoes.  They used to sell them here.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to the store?

speaker: Tramp
text: Moved.

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you know where?

speaker: Tramp
text: Yeah.  It'll cost you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_going into his pocket_] How much?

speaker: Tramp
text: Not money.  I want a kiss.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_horrified_] What?

speaker: Martin
text: You heard him.

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: You heard him.  You owe me.  It's only a kiss.

speaker: Tramp
text: Not her. [_smiles at Martin_] _Martin looks terrified and goes to hide behind Daphne who is busy smiling at him.  FADE TO:  Scene Two -- KACL. Frasier is finishing up his show. _

speaker: Frasier
text: This is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780 Talk radio.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought you'd never finish.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, what say I buy us dinner with a lot of martinis?

speaker: Niles
text: Sounds great, except for the dinner part!

speaker: Frasier
text: I take it you had a bad day too?

speaker: Niles
text: I had an abysmal day.  Remember the ad I placed?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes - "Dr. Niles Crane, Jung specialist," blah blah blah.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Well, they've made a tiny little typo.  See if you can find it. [_hands Frasier the magazine_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_reading_] "Dr. Niles Crane..." [_a look of realisation_] "Hung specialist."  Oh, my!

speaker: Niles
text: The rest they got perfectly. [_continues reading_] "Servicing individuals, couples, groups.  Satisfaction guaranteed." [_looks at Frasier with a sorrowful face_] "Tell me where it hurts!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... any calls?

speaker: Niles
text: It's a telethon, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  We'll start with double martinis. _Niles and Frasier leave the booth and run into Bulldog, who is on the phone to Sharon._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey Doc, wait a second.  I need the name of one of those fancy restaurants you go to. [_into phone_] Hey, hi Sharon. It's me, Bob.  I had a great time last night.  Listen, how about dinner tonight?  You do?  All right, how about tomorrow night?  Hey, it's a good thing I'm not paranoid -- I'd think you were dumping me! [_pause_] Whoa, I walked into that one! Yeah, me too.  Good luck, Sharon. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry, Bulldog.

speaker: Niles
text: [_placing his hands supportively on Bulldog's shoulders_] Me too. [_moves Bulldog away from the phone_] I'll call Francois, see if he can get us a table on the patio.

speaker: Pete
text: [_poking his head out the booth_] Ten seconds, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_running into the booth_] Oh, right, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_following him in_] Bulldog -- are you going to be all right?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Me?  Huh, are you kidding?  I'm the Bulldog! _He rattles his accessories and sits down to start his show while Frasier leaves._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Attention, sports fans, you're in the Doghouse! [_barks, but breaks off midway_] First, some weekend scores.  In football the Packers _crushed_ the Saints [_stuttering_] 42 to 10 and the 49ers _humiliated_ [_nearly in tears_] the Patriots 35 to 7. And in golf... _Bulldog takes a long pause.  By now Frasier has joined Roz and Pete in the booth and all are looking concerned._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Golf?  Hey, golf sucks.  Let's go to calls. [_puts a caller through_] Hey, you're in the Doghouse.  Put on a flea collar! _Bulldog speaks to the caller.  Meanwhile Niles rushes into the studio to speak to Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: We have the table, Frasier, but Francois says he can only hold it for ten minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_brushing Niles off_] In a minute.

speaker: Jerry
text: [_v.o._] What's up with the rumour that the Seahawks are thinking of leaving Seattle again?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I have no respect for them, man.  Anyone who has their fun, then they [_nearly in tears again_] just leave you... hey, to hell with them, right?  We'll get another team.  A team that- a team that will never leave us... [_breaks down completely into tears_] ...a team we can love forever.

speaker: Roz
text: You gotta go to commercial.

speaker: Pete
text: I already did.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rushing into the booth_] Bulldog, are you going to be all right?  Do you think you can take the show?

speaker: Roz
text: Wait, Bulldog.  We need a tape.  Where's "The Best of Bulldog"?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_weeping_] She took the best of Bulldog!

speaker: Pete
text: We got dead air in fifteen seconds.

speaker: Roz
text: Great.  OK, I'll go get Bulldog. [_turns to Frasier_] You take over the show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?  A sports show?

speaker: Roz
text: [_rushing out_] You're the only one here. _Frasier takes his seat and rushes about, putting his headphones on the wrong way, hitting Bulldog's horn and generally looking completely lost._

speaker: Frasier
text: OK, sports enthusiasts.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane filling in for Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe. [_bangs a cymbal_] You're on the air.

speaker: Mike
text: [_v.o._] This is Mike.  I wanted to talk to Bulldog but you'll do.  So what's your take on the damn Yankees this season?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you speaking of the frothy musical adaptation, or the baseball team of which I know nothing?

speaker: Mike
text: What a weenie! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't that take me back?  But he brings up a good point. You see, while I'm on the air, please feel free to call up about anything other than sports.  Please. [_takes a call_] Hello, you're on the air.

speaker: Jake
text: [_v.o._] Yeah.  You think it was a good idea for the Sonics to give up those draft choices so they could free up some money under the cap, you know, to go after a wide body to help them in the paint?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_staring straight ahead, completely and utterly lost_] Yes! [_takes another call_] You're on the air. _CUT TO: The scene switches to the men's bathroom.  Roz rushes in to try and find Bulldog who is hiding in a stall.  There is a man standing at the urinal._

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, I know you're in there.  Get out here! [_turns to see the man who doesn't look pleased to see her_] Oh, give me a break, Leonard -- like you haven't fantasized about this moment.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Go away, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Will you grow up?  So you got dumped.  You got a little payback for the way you've treated women all your life. Besides, the Bulldog I know doesn't get sad.  He gets angry.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You're right! [_shouting violently:_] THIS STINKS!  THIS IS TOTAL... [_breaks down again_] ...total B.S.

speaker: Roz
text: If you don't come out in the next thirty seconds I'm going to reach in there and grab you out by your ankles!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Roz.  Playing hard to get?

speaker: Roz
text: It's Bulldog.  You're a psychiatrist, help him.

speaker: Niles
text: As distressed as I am by his condition, he's not the only one who's suffering here.  In eight minutes Frasier and I are going to lose our patio table.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, as long as Frasier is filling in for Bulldog you're not going anywhere. _Niles looks shocked and turns to help Bulldog while brushing Roz out the bathroom._

speaker: Niles
text: You poor man.  Help is at hand!

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no shrinks.  I hate shrinks.  You're all a bunch of wimps, weirdos... [_comes out the cubicle and collapses in tears on Niles's shoulders_] Help me!

speaker: Niles
text: There, there.  I'm here for you. [_pushes Bulldog away_] And you're over there for me.  Well, I sense you're in a great deal of pain.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah.  Make it stop.

speaker: Niles
text: No.  The first step towards healing is not to bury the pain, but to feel it at its fullest depth.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, well before security arrives, let's skip onto step two.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is going on?

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, Bulldog.  Frasier, please, we are in session.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, Niles, we have to pull this man together in minutes, not in a lifetime!

speaker: Niles
text: How dare you talk to me like that! _Niles and Frasier proceed to argue loudly while Bulldog remains curled up on the bathroom floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: We don't have the time for this.  Now get out!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  Bulldog, I'm referring you to my brother.  Frasier, I'll call Francois and tell him there's been a death in the family.  That ought to buy us another ten minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Bulldog.  Look, we're on a newsbreak.  You have got to pull yourself together, because there is no way I'm enduring anymore of that humiliation!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm not going out there, man.

speaker: Frasier
text: You have got to!  I can't even decipher the abbreviations on the scoresheets.  I'm guessing by your producer's guffaws that "IND" is not the Cleveland Independents!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I just never felt this way about a chick before.  I was even thinking about me and her having kids.  Isn't that scary?

speaker: Frasier
text: Positively bone chilling.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_weeping_] It hurts like hell.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, I know, Bulldog.  You know, often through pain we can achieve emotional growth.  It reminds me of a paper I recently presented to the Vancouver Psychiatric Association. The ground of my discourse was that the sufferer - i.e., you...

speaker: Bulldog
text: Doc, Doc, you're hurting my head here!  Can you stop being a shrink and just be like a guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinking_] Like a guy... Like a guy... [_pauses for a moment_] SCREW HER!

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] Yeah, you don't need her.  She's trash!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, that's right.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're better off without her, we both are!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I like the sound of this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, so do I.  Unattractive yet liberating, rather like the one and only time I wore a European bathing suit. [_realising he's going off track_] I'm sorry.  SHE'S A BITCH!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, she wasn't even that hot.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right.  All she did was save you the trouble of having to dump her!

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_upbeat_] I never thought about that.

speaker: Frasier
text: There you go!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm feeling a little better, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Thanks.  It's great talking to you [_holds out his hand_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shaking his hand_] Likewise.  You know I could talk like this for another [_checks his watch_] thirty seconds. _The scene switches to the booth as Frasier and Bulldog walk in and Bulldog takes his seat for the show._

speaker: Frasier
text: She was nothing!  She was less than nothing!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tomorrow you're gonna find someone even hotter, and you know what you're gonna do?

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: You're gonna have your fun with her, and then you're gonna DUMP her just for the hell of it!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, DUMP HER!

speaker: Frasier
text: And you know what?!  You're not gonna feel bad about it at all!  And you know why?!  BECAUSE WE'RE GUYS!  AND THAT'S WHAT GUYS DO!!!!! _Bulldog raises his arms in joy and lets out a dog howl.  Frasier about turns and walks out the booth, meeting Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: Distressing news, Frasier: Francois gave away our table.

speaker: Frasier
text: SCREW HIM!

speaker: Niles
text: [_shocked_] Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: You heard what I said!  We don't need him or his stinky little restaurant!  There are plenty of restaurants in town! I say we go somewhere we don't even need a reservation!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you know, if we hasten, perhaps we can catch the first seating at Cigar Volante. _Frasier and Niles run out the corridor, both with fairly prancing gaits.  End of Act 2_
